properties.name: Alhambra Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by TableauvivanteMonterey and East Bay State streets, Alhambra, CAMonterey and East Bay State streets 8:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. (626) 570-5081 The Alhambra market is a warm and friendly place. The variety of vegetables on display showcases the diversity that LA is known for, supplying the customer with everything from Peruvian empanadas to every Asian green under the sun. Parking is available in the lot across the street.

properties.name: Auntie Em's Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante4616 Eagle Rock Blvd., Los AngelesBreakfast is best, but lunch doesn\'t suck either. And the Red Velvet cupcakes? Use a fork and a friend. Visit the cheese shop next door. Have the meatloaf. It\'s ALL good. And Intellegentsia coffee to wash it down.

properties.name: Europane
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante950 E. Colorado Blvd., PasadenaIs it a bakery? Is it a cafe? Yes. The egg salad sandwich is heaven on toast. Take home a box of croissants. Marvel at their thick cappuccino foam.

properties.name: Fosselman's Ice Cream
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante1824 W Main St, Alhambra, CA1824 W. Main St. Alhambra, CA 91801 626-282-6533 Store Hours: Monday thru Saturday: 10:00 AM to 10:00 PM Sunday: 11:30 AM to 10:00 PM Old school before old school was cool. This is the ice cream of our youth. Except the flavors are done California style. Lychee. Mexican Chocolate. Or JJ\'s favorite - Lemon Custard. There\'s peach in summer and orange in winter. I\'m patiently waiting for a persimmon ice cream though. They\'ve been there for ages and I hope that despite beind surrounded by car dealerships and warehouse stores, they\'ll scoop it up for many years to come.

properties.name: Il Capo Cafe and Deli
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante 1001 green st., pasadena, ca1001 E Green Street Pasadena, CA 91106 (626) 683-0550 This is the kind of place you wish was in your neighborhood. Tapas extraordinaire. Service that treats you like royalty. And the dulce de leche...lordy. Argentine yum on a plate. Take home some of the Malbec you had with dinner - their wine nook at the back is well-stocked.

properties.name: Little Flower Candy Company
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante1424 W Colorado Blvd, Pasadena, CABurrata on ciabata? Good, French butter with ham? All this and super soft melty caramels in sea salt, vanilla, and lemon. Good eating. Christine is a wiz with food. And she\'s in my town. Lucky me.

properties.name: Pasadena Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by TableauvivanteSaturdays, year-round, North Sierra Madre Boulevard and Paloma Street, 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

properties.name: Pasadena Sandwich Company
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante259 Sierra Madre Villa Ave, Pasadena, CA259 Sierra Madre Villa Ave Pasadena, CA 91107 (626) 578-1616 Best sandwich shop in all of LA? Perhaps. It\'s just that good. My favorite is \'Trust the Cook\'. Go hungry.

properties.name: Shin Sen Gumi Hakata Ramen
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante8450 E. Valley Blvd. #103, Rosemead, CA 917708450 E. Valley Blvd. #103 Rosemead, CA 91770 Phone: (626) 572-8646 Fax: (626) 572-8646 Steamy bowls of milky tan broth and noodles-as-you-like-them. I\'ve heard people poo-poo the Rosemead location as the weak link in the formidable Shin Sen Gumi empire. To them I say, yes, please, go to the Gardena location - I won\'t have to wait for a table as long. It may not be the most showy or the most admired. But the Rosemead Shin Sen Gumi is *my* Shin Sen Gumi. The waiters never fail me - Ryo-san is our favorite. The tea is always poured right when I need it. The soup is always good and hot and tasty.

properties.name: Taylor's Meat Market
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante14 E Sierra Madre Blvd14 E Sierra Madre Blvd Sierra Madre, CA 91024 (626) 355-8267 Taylor\'s Meat market was born the same year I was. When I was small, I would watch the back staff make the custom sausages that have made Taylor\'s the go-to place for great meats in So Cal. Chops cut to your preference. Plump chickens. Soup bones galore. Steaks and roasts and a rich ground round done in house that makes the best meatballs and hamburgers I\'ve ever tasted. It\'s the last of a dying breed.

properties.name: Zephyr Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Tableauvivante Zephyr Coffee House 2419 E. Colorado Blvd. Best kept secret in Pas. Their brick patio, shaded by apple and citrus trees, is ideal for a quiet lunch or quick coffee moment. Their roasted red pepper panini tastes great with a Tea Hee Hee. One of my favorite places for a quiet moment out of the house.
